title: East German VW Deal
title_page: East German VW Deal - The New York Times
maintext:
Volkswagen, West Germany's leading car producer, said today that it is planning to install an engine assembly line in East Germany under a $222 million deal.
A company spokesman said the assembly line would produce 286,000 engines a year; 100,000 would go to Volkswagen's West German plant in Salzgitter and the rest would be for East Germany's own use.
Negotiations are expected to be completed by the middle of the year, the spokesman said, and production could start as soon as 1988.
Under the proposed contract, Volkswagen would also deliver 2,000 trucks and other vehicles to East Germany immediately after the agreement is signed, to be followed by annual deliveries of 2,300 vehicles, the spokesman said.
